name: grounding_object_in_image(image_id: str, object_name: str, object_type: str) -> dict

variables.name: image_id
variables.description: he unique identifier of the image

variables.name: object_name
variables.description: A textual description of the scene or objects in the image.

variables.name: object_type
variables.description: A comma-separated list of objects to be identified and marked in the image

example_conversation_prompt.content:
<image>{
 'id': '657eafdeef3d6763710dffa2', 
'url': '/images/657eafdeef3d6763710dffa2'}
 </image>
Can you ground the according object inside the image?

Context:
image_id='657eafdeef3d6763710dffa2'
 object_name='coyote'
object_type='coyote'
Task: Grounding the object inside the image.
Question: Can you ground the according object inside the image?
There is 1 object is grounded inside the image with the bounding box of [536.8339233398438, 420.549560546875, 1368.544921875, 1178.9544677734375].
